[Home](./index.md) &gt; [spotfire-api](./spotfire-api.md) &gt; [Mod](./spotfire-api.mod.md)

## Mod interface

The Mod API exposes methods for interacting with Spotfire.

Reading content from the Mod is done with a \[reader\](mod.html\#reader). TODO: Write/review documentation

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface ModApi 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [controls](./spotfire-api.mod.controls.md) | <code>Controls</code> | Methods for showing controls, for example a Spotfire context menu. |
|  [document](./spotfire-api.mod.document.md) | <code>SpotfireDocument</code> | The Spotfire document. |
|  [mod](./spotfire-api.mod.mod.md) | <code>ModVisualization</code> | All types of content in the mod that can be read and/or modified by the mod API. Observables can be used as parameters to the <code>api.reader</code> method in order to read the content. |
|  [plot](./spotfire-api.mod.plot.md) | <code>Plot</code> | Static methods for interacting with a data view. |

## Methods

|  Method | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [getRenderContext()](./spotfire-api.mod.getrendercontext.md) | Get the mod's render context. This function should be invoked as soon as possible in the initialize callback. If <code>getRenderContext</code> is not called in the <code>initialize</code> callback, the mod will be automatically exported after one second. |
|  [onError(errorCallback)](./spotfire-api.mod.onerror.md) | General error handler. |
|  [reader(observables)](./spotfire-api.mod.reader.md) | Read content for the mod. All content names will be converted into values in the callback. The reader method will return a \[ReadFunction\](readfunction.html) that can be used to read content values. |
|  [transaction(action)](./spotfire-api.mod.transaction.md) | Perform a set of synchronous modifications in an explicit transaction. The transaction method is only needed if you want to be sure that a set of modifications are done as one transaction (one undo step). Modifications done outside of a transaction action callback will be grouped together in an implicit transaction. |
